repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Peasant Enterprise Zones
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Peasant Enterprise Zones Development
            Project for Colombia had a satisfactory outcome with likely
            sustainability, high institutional development, and
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank and the Borrower.
            The project objectives were achieved despite worsening
            security conditions in parts of the Project area and
            unexpected difficulties due to internal and external
            factors.  Lessons were learned in the areas of: commitment
            to community empowerment and local self-management;  working
            in conflict zones; and programs that cross sectoral
            boundaries and require inter-sectoral coordination. Key
            lessons included: substantial time is required to develop
            the model of intervention; there is value in investing in
            participatory processes; conflict zones limit the presence
            of government institutions; and inter-sectoral coordination
            cannot be taken for granted

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Peasant Enterprise Zones for
            Peace Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Peasant Enterprise
            Zones for Peace Project is to develop a replicable
            methodology for the establishment and operation of a Peasant
            Enterprise Zone (Zona de Reserve Campesino) for areas of
            colonization affected by violence and illicit activities and
            of prototype actions to protect rainforest reserves and
            nearby indigenous territories. The project includes three
            components: (i) a Project Management Unit (PMG) will be
            set-up in the Interamerican Institute for Agricultural
            Cooperation (IICA), which will be responsible for overall
            project coordination, monitoring, and administration; (ii)
            Peasant Enterprise Zone Development, which will include
            participatory planing and implementation of land titling
            efforts, agricultural production activities, and
            environmental protection initiatives, and local capacity
            building for community and economic development; and (iii)
            an Evaluation and Strategic Design of Follow-on Action,
            which would enable Government of Colombia to apply the
            concept of peasant enterprise zones on a wider scale based
            on sound economic, social, and environmental criteria.
